title.narrative: Reducing Food Insecurity through Cash Assistance to the Drought Affected Communities in Karamoja region.

description.narrative: The main objective of this $400,000 FAO project is to reduce food insecurity and strengthen the resilience of households experiencing income loss across five districts in Uganda’s Karamoja region, thus limiting the social and economic consequences of two consecutive seasons of less than normal crop and animal production. To that end, FAO is making a one-time transfer of unconditional cash to address the most immediate, drought-induced needs of 5,000 affected people, including 2,300 men, 2,700 women and 120 persons with disabilities.
